Malala Yousafzai: Malala is a remarkable human rights activist who has fought against the oppression of girls and women in Pakistan. Swapping places with her would provide me with a unique perspective on her life and the challenges she has faced. I would also be interested in learning about her work and the impact she has had on the world.

David Attenborough: As a naturalist and broadcaster, David Attenborough has dedicated his life to sharing the wonders of the natural world. Swapping places with him would allow me to explore the planet and gain a deeper appreciation for the diversity of life on Earth. I would also be interested in learning about his experiences in the field and his approach to conservation.

Lin-Manuel Miranda: Lin-Manuel Miranda is a talented composer, playwright, and actor who has created some of the most iconic musicals of our time. Swapping places with him would provide me with a behind-the-scenes look at the creative process and allow me to see firsthand the impact his work has had on audiences around the world.

Nelson Mandela: Nelson Mandela was a political activist and anti-apartheid leader who spent 27 years in prison for his beliefs. Swapping places with him would give me a glimpse into his life and the struggles he faced during his fight for equality and justice. I would also be interested in learning about his leadership and how he inspired others to stand up for what they believed in.

Jane Goodall: Jane Goodall is a primatologist and conservationist who has dedicated her life to studying and protecting chimpanzees. Swapping places with her would provide me with a unique perspective on the natural world and allow me to learn more about her groundbreaking research and the impact she has had on conservation efforts.
